page.title: 09Portland Windmills
page.content:
The ruins of two corn-grinding windmills exist within sight of each other. Although of ancient origin it is difficult to date them. They are not mentioned in the original Domesday book but are marked on a map dated 1626. The Portland tradition of agriculture gave small areas individual names. The two windmills are close to each other but the northern one is at Cottonfields and the southern one at Top Growlands. Without sail or roof only the cylindrical Portland stone shells remain standing on waste ground.
Liz Bartlett
